pros: Great product that produces winning results for clients. Good Partnerships in the industry. Bright, airy office that you want to go to for the collaboration and friendships coupled with the flexibility to work at home when needed.
good people, relaxed environment, room for initiative
cons: unorganized employee management, lack of information sharing from high management

review_title: Had great potential, but poor management ruins it.
years_at_company: Had great potential, but poor management ruins it.
pros:
Dedicated smart people
Friendly environment
Great idea
cons:
CEO has no capability (or will) to motivate the employees, only care about getting more customers. And if you decided to leave (even after more than a few years), he may hold a grudge towards you.
And the policy of chasing the competition is a joke. Instead of leading, we spent half the time doing what our competitors already did.

VP R&D is a great person, but seems to be "tired" in the last few years, could have taken the R&D way up if he put his mind to it.

Unorganized product management process, making developing new features long and tiring.
advice_to_mgmt: People that are leaving haven't lost faith in the company, they did in the management... Think about it.

pros:
Room for initiative and personal growth.
CTO is very talented.
Salaries are ok.
cons:
Unprofessional team leader.
high management acting like army unit.
Really bad in employee retention.

review_title: A great place to work at
years_at_company: A great place to work at
pros: Very talented people and a good atmosphere.

review_title: if they find their path might be good
years_at_company: if they find their path might be good
pros: lots of changes hence lots to do.
cons: not always what one would get there to do.
advice_to_mgmt: find the actual path and stick to it, change is good but not when it happens too frequently.
